maptopo

Draws contours on a plot map. Elevmat has elevation data in matrix form; plot dimensions are not needed, instead it calculates them from elevmat and the gridsize. If add=TRUE, they are added to an existing map. If new=TRUE, a new screen window is created.

This is called by map(), and see the description of map() for the other arguments. It can be used on its own though.

maptopo(elevmat, plotdim, add = FALSE, new = FALSE, export = "no",
  interval = 0, xrange = NULL, yrange = NULL, xaxis = TRUE,
  yaxis = TRUE, axspos = 0.5, labelsize = 1.15, maintitle = "",
  ht = 6, wd = 9, plotside = 4.5, filepath = "", clr = "black",
  bgcolor = "transparent")

Contents

Developed by Rick Condit, Pamela Hall, Suzanne Lao, Kyle Harms, Mauro Lepore, CTFS-ForestGEO.
